113959: My mind is growing even bigger. It feels like you could fit the entire sky and ocean inside it.
915495: Yea! Let's go on a big adventure!
1603183: I get homesick once in a while, too, so I completely relate to all the international merchants on Ritou. I try to look out for them as much as I can. The difference between us is that they see themselves as just passing by, and have no intention of trying to integrate here. And because that's how they think, it becomes their reality. The majority of Inazumans will never see them as anything more than outsiders.
2194999: Every moment of the summer festival is a moving tale. Those who meet under the light of fireworks grow up, mature, and grow old. When they set off the same fireworks as they did in the beginning, the skies reflect that same image from years ago... Fireworks are not eternal, but I believe that the wonderful emotions behind them should walk alongside Inazuma into eternity.
2701775: I've lived around Eremites my whole life. As a little girl, I had a wooden sword for a toy. Everyone I knew growing up was either a merc or on their way to becoming one, and even the bowls we ate our meals from were carved by mercenary blades... After an upbringing like that, it'd be more surprising if I didn't become a merc when I grew up, right?
3580415: There was this one fellow who invited me to perform at his place, back when there weren't many who would give my music the time of day. I was touched, let me tell you what. Like, hey, someone gets it! I agreed right away... But when I got there, I found out that he was the consultant at the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. What a weird guy. I mean, how was that appropriate?
6347431: Good morning. A little sword practice while the day is young is good for the body and mind. I tend to avoid having anything scheduled during these hours... What do you say? Fancy crossing blades with me?
6465783: The artwork in the manor? It's not mine. It's a collection that belonged to my late father.
6524967: I'm a pro at hunting, you know! How about I show you some of my skills? Or even better... how about a little competition?
7521455: Every journey has its final day. Don't rush.
8271535: Every time I get on stage I always start to doubt myself — can I really heal every person in Mondstadt? But I look at you now, and I feel that as long as we keep marching forward, maybe one day I might just— Huh? I've already healed you? Well, one's not enough! I've already healed a lot of people? I suppose...
9860143: The view from the Cathedral's clock tower is amazing! You should check it out.
12730047: You know Ajilenakh Nuts, right? I used to go crazy for them as a kid... but my dad was the worst at shelling them. He'd just hack 'em to pieces with his knife, leaving a bunch of inedible mush behind. In the end, he'd salvage what he could by scraping pieces of the flesh off the shell, then mixing it with some milk and calling it porridge.\n...I do miss the taste of that porridge sometimes... and I miss that old nut-cracker, too.
12968255: The wind is picking up. There is conflict in the air.
14142287: Though I occasionally get a little weary of the sight of it — I can't exactly avoid seeing it at the Grand Narukami Shrine, after all — my fate is intimately intertwined with the Sacred Sakura.
14657343: That young lady says the most bizarre-sounding things, yet she appears to be rather highly regarded by the staff of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor — even Rex Lapis himself saw fit to serve under her in some sort of "consultancy" capacity... 15283495: Shall we roll some dice? Whoever gets the lowest number... gets to eat it.
15757647:
#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Paimon thought we'd be saying goodbye to the amazing cafés after we left Sumeru. But it seems like people in Fontaine are big coffee drinkers too!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>They sure are. Even the newspapers run articles about how great coffee is at keeping you awake and alert. And at boosting your energy levels, so you can keep performing at peak efficiency during a long working day.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Whew, any job where you need coffee to stay energized must be exhausting...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Like, umm... Blacksmiths? Maybe chefs too... And adventurers — they're always running around all over the place. Hey, and what about divers?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Divers, huh? That's definitely the odd one out here...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>How are divers supposed to drink coffee when they work underwater the entire time?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Yeah, that's a good question!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>They can't take off their helmets underwater, so they'd probably have to shut themselves inside an even bigger glass box and drain all the water out before they could finally drink their coffee. Probably from a bottle...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>No, wait... If the coffee's already in a bottle, all they'd need is a long straw that goes from the bottle into their helmet. Then they'd be able to take a sip of coffee whenever they want!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Hehe, eww, haha. But then the coffee would go cold!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Cold coffee is just gross. With the important exception of iced coffee, but that's its own thing.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Well that's no problem. They can just bring a stove with them underwater.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>You've seen the kind of stove that most people use in Fontaine, right? It only has one small opening up at the top. As long as that's sealed nice and tight, it won't go out even underwater!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Wait a second... No way, is that... That's it! That must be the whole reason stoves in Fontaine are made that way!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Ding ding ding, right answer! That is indeed the reason behind the design of the Fontaine-style stove.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Hehe, Paimon's the smartest!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Hey, how about we open an underwater café? Paimon bets there's lots of divers out there craving some coffee while they're down in the depths... Yeah, this could be a huge opportunity for us!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Once we open the world's first-ever underwater café, the Mora will come rolling in! Heck, and why stop at cafés? The ocean's our oyster! We could build a whole shopping mall down there! Then a whole underwater business district...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Hee-hee! Ah, it's gotta be the best feeling in the world, making Mora through your very own stroke of business genius!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Just one thing, okay? ...Don't go taking out a loan in my name!
16605375: On stormy days, the people of Inazuma chant "kuwabara, kuwabara," believing that this will protect themselves from being struck by lightning. You need not worry about any storm summoned by my own hand — they will bring you no harm. Lightning storms that occur naturally, however, can be more unpredictable.
20960007: Let's see... "I want to understand Ganyu better..." Wh—What sort of request is that!? I've never done this before... Um, um, um... Okay... I can, ah... run you through my annual review from last year? That should bring you up to speed on me... No good? Oh, okay then...
21231047: Since we first met, I have had a warm feeling inside. Not the kind of warmth that makes me feel rotten. The other kind of warm. The one that happens inside my heart. Thank you. I am happy. Sadly I only recognize the current you. If I forget you... No. I will order myself to remember you.
22416983: Ah, dear Chongyun. Though he understands me quite well, one has to exercise caution when teaming up with him to go on a quest. He is making good progress in the martial arts, but I would say he hasn't quite internalized the chivalric code yet... He needs more practice. Especially at eating spicy food...
22825271: This... travel companion of yours — do you know anything of her origins? No matter what, I cannot seem to discern a single shred of information regarding this floating fairy's fate.\n...Oh? So you don't know where she comes from, either?
25099399: Recon confirms, no sign of the shrine maiden within a 3-mile radius. Moving to the next phase: sleepy time!
26018751: This is truly a great investment. Sure, no Mora has been made from it, but the time I've spent with you is already a solid return. Haha, seems I win again — I put my money on the right person.
26951671: Keqing's a very thoughtful person, and she always does a good job of everything. She also makes sure to pay Master a visit at every festival... She's what you call a "bastion of piety." Or wait, maybe it's "paragon of propriety"? ...Well, anyway, I think I can learn a lot from her!
27123559: Yes, you've guessed correctly. The preservation of a thread of Qiqi's consciousness was in fact the work of the adepti. Since the adepti took pity on this child and even used their arts to keep her on this side of existence, I thought I'd take the opportunity to keep her around the pharmacy. There's no harm in that, is there?
27637207: Oh... D—Dori... ahem... I took the plunge and bought something from her once. She looked euphoric as I was settling the bill — I think she assumed I was some sort of mega-rich person. 'cause not only did I spend all of my scholarship money in one go, but for most of the next year, I had to survive mainly on cheap vegetables, and I couldn't buy textbooks unless they were on sale...
28347119: We once discussed matters concerning the summer festival deep into the night. We were both really tired, and I invited her to go take a bath. 28481903: Every time Klee wants to play with me, I take her somewhere far from the tavern. Alcohol and explosives... yeah, that's a dangerous combination! I mean, do I want to destroy the wine industry of Mondstadt? Yes, but not in that sense!
28761687: Honestly, did you use the wrong seasonings?
29276919: Wow, these will come in handy!
30590871: Huh? You wanna know the name of my style of ninjutsu? Uhh... Y'know what, I can't think straight right now, I'm still half asleep here. Lemme snooze a while longer, maybe my mind'll be clearer when I wake up.
30803303: If I can guard shipments, I can guard people. Since you seem to trust me, how 'bout I be your bodyguard from now on?
34035207: I'd rather be diving in the sea.
35659167: I should have stayed indoors today.
37253343: (Translated) Fie! This cold shall be mine end!
37433655: Let's not eat here. Mind if I... take it home?
38932159: Whoa, is this all for me? Dang, how much did this put you out? You shouldn't have...
39177871: I can't handle coffee. More than half a cup and before long, my heart starts racing and I can't calm my breathing down. Everyone says that coffee can boost your energy levels, but to me, it's torture...
39226319: Now that the Vision Hunt Decree is over, Watatsumi Island has once again returned to normal life. It is my hope that the Shogun will fulfill her promise and that we can live with the Shogunate in peace. However, if there comes a day when she once again casts aside the aspirations of the people, I can assure you that we won't sit by and watch.
40178079: Ugh, that's going back in the wash...
43373703: Serious question: why don't you become my student? I'll tailor research topics to your needs and thoroughly explain everything you need to know. I've walked the walk, so I can promise you that everything you'd learn would be a great boon for your future adventures. There's no reason not to trust me!
43635327: Well are those who rise in the early morn, while those late to bed I shall forewarn~
44073071: Drawing Star Charts is really tiring work... I really don't think I'd be able to keep at it if it wasn't something I'm interested in. But then when I look at the finished product, a huge, neatly drawn, accurate map of the stars... it always gives me a huge sense of accomplishment.
45527959: If my master were to learn about this, she'd probably have me add some more red ropes...
47475919:
#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> If you want to adventure together with Benny's Adventure Team, you have to come prepared.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Domains are very dangerous, so you should always take care to double- and triple-check your supplies in advance.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Paimon's heard that the Adventurers' Guild has compiled a list of 463 different ways of dying in these domains...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> If Bennett got you killed by accident, Paimon and Bennett would never forgive ourselves!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> ...Why am I the only one dying here?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Well, that's because according to the numbers, Paimon can avoid 322 causes of death just by floating!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> I suddenly don't feel like exploring these domains...
48567583: Awesome, now I can slip away faster than ever. Hee-hee, they can't catch me now.
52824983: That's more like it! As expected, my dazzling side comes through in any situation.
53137551: Is it time for a magic show?
53322583: Granny Oni isn't an oni at all... In fact, she's the kindest human that has ever lived. She only got her nickname because she took me in. 53475623: Fall back and await my orders.
54319807: This must be what it feels like to have flavors dancing on your tongue... How wonderful!
54392831: ♪La~la~la~ Steamed fish with a side of prawn dumplings~
54662231: What was that? Oh... it's gone. Can I go take a look?
55858655: The Yuheng, Keqing... she's quite hard to talk to. She's so uptight, hehe... Really makes me wanna mess with her. She wouldn't knock me in the head with her sword though, right? Or would she...?
58277655: Sunglasses are great at keeping the sand out of your eyes so you can see your way! Except at night... then you can't see anything at all...
58903191: I'm Sucrose, a researcher of alchemy. I heard you've been to a lot of places, so I was wondering if you... Ah, what am I saying! It's only our first time meeting, I shouldn't trouble you. 59186535: In this weather, I can freeze monsters in place and simply let the lightning bolts take care of the rest. A good way to not get my clothes dirty.
62709119: There's nothing timid about you, having the courage to ask about my hobbies.\nSo, fight me. How long do you think your body will last against my blows?
63438487: The wind never blows in the Sanctuary of Surasthana... Oh, sorry. That's probably obvious to you.
64193935: I gaze up at the moon and lend my ear to the gentle breeze, with wine in my cup and peace in my heart... Have a wonderful evening.
65636631: "The dads..." That's how I refer to all the older adventurers in Mondstadt. Apparently, I was an orphan kid that they rescued from the most perilous situation ever. How cool is that? 66056023: I have great affection for the arts: music, song, poetry, shougi, and dancing. And you?
69517639: As for Mona? She seems to be an excellent mage, but I'm not a part of their Hexenzirkel. The idea of Irminsul exploration and formal tea parties just leaves me cold.

#<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> Everyone says that Mondstadt is the land of the wind.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> But I wonder which direction the seasonal winds come from.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Why don't we ask Venti?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> He'll probably just dodge the question with a "hehe" or something...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> True. The Anemo Archon is just a Tone-Deaf Bard. What does he know about the wind?
71610983: I've heard about the murder case involving Navia's father. It caused quite the stir in the Maison Gardiennage at the time. It was the source of many disagreements, I believe.\nFortunately, the truth has come to light and the true culprit has been held accountable... Justice may not always be swift, but it always prevails in the end.
71792199: Why do Mist Flowers have to be so rare? The powder they produce works wonders for the bone whistle. It gives it a crisper, clearer sound.
72674383: I often see her wandering in the woods singing strange songs. Actually, I must have heard all of her songs several times each by now. I'm used to her singing, but I still find it strange. That being said, I don't hate it either.
73443159: Mr. Shikanoin belongs to the Tenryou Commission, just like Miss Kujou. He is very... principled, sometimes even more determinedly so than Miss Kujou. The only thing is, when it comes to the question of which matters should be governed by his principles, I believe only Mr. Shikanoin himself knows the answer...
73508039: Don't despair, I'm here to help.
74557855: Is there time to sneak in some dim sum first?
75067935: I once thought that deification would allow me to get rid of all of my pointless emotions, but I've since abandoned that view. Anger, whether it be from others or myself, is too convenient and useful as a tool.\nHow can some people just never become angry? I find that impossible to even imagine. Do they just not have a single mean bone in their bodies?
75698543:
#<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> Paimon, have you ever seen what Kaeya looks like under that eye patch?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Nope.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> So, it would seem he never takes it off...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Actually, Paimon already knows why!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> Oh?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> He must be hiding some big secret!

<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> See, Kaeya heads out for assignments more than anyone else.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> So the skin under that eye patch has to be way lighter than the rest of him.

<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> He'll definitely become the butt of everyone's jokes. Maybe he'll even get a weird nickname!

<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> Guess he didn't need to take it off to get a weird nickname...
77214479: Countless souls have fallen prey to these hands. I too have been swallowed by the darkness — and yet you dare to drive me on. You may think of me as... your companion. You seek to find me salvation? \n...You... really are a difficult being to comprehend.
80441191: The boss has a lot of unpleasant memories from his past, but he still manages to stay positive. I'd say that kind of resilience is pretty rare. He treats us well and his character has a good effect on everyone in the gang. Of course, it's never an excuse for him to run amok with no consideration for others. Just let me know if he ever causes you any trouble and I'll be sure to make him regret ever being rude to you.
80929079: You and I have a contract, so feel free to discuss anything at all within the scope of said contract.
81301943: Clorinde is the best Champion Duelist you can find. Her combat prowess is already the stuff of legend. I've never fought her myself, but that's because there's never been a need for it.
83850015: Treasure... one way to draw your target out of hiding.
84852511: Charlotte has been trying to get me to agree to an interview ever since we met... Ugh, it feels like she's already asked twenty times now. She has a good nose for finding news, and she's the persistent type, too. But to be honest, I have no desire to find myself in the spotlight of one of her breaking news stories, and so I've found all sorts of reasons to decline each time.
86821391: I'll be taking some time for myself now. Goodbye.
88086223: Good morning! I saw that you hadn't woken up yet, so I went out and got you some food. Oh, don't worry, there aren't any squirrels or finches in it. Even though they're delicious too...
91387559: You wish to know more about one's past? ...One doubts there would be much worth sharing — it's all ancient history by now. One is more interested to hear about your travels to the far-flung corners of the world... What forms do the gods and immortals of other nations take? Are there any of them as amenable to conversation as oneself? Let us brew some tea, and then you can tell me all about it.
91388375: I'll eat absolutely anything! There are no bad ingredients, only bad cooking!
91405655: Once, I secretly left the mountain and returned to my childhood village without telling my master. But it was deserted, and my father had long since passed away. I suddenly realized that the bond between my relatives and I had been completely severed. And nothing that I'd ever cared about in the past could ever have a future. Ever since then, I have abandoned everything related to the mortal world... That is, until I met you.
92820039: Not bad... Not bad at all!
92921879: On some nights, I almost feel like someone is doing stretches together with me. But maybe I just have an overactive imagination.
93080767: Thank you for permitting— No, inviting me to join you.
93497231: What a sight to behold, the sun so warm and radiant...
94729367: The Dendro Archon... When I was a kid, there were so many times when I just wanted to scream out to the gods and ask them why, why did I have to go through so much pain...? *sigh* But, for all I know, maybe the gods feel just as helpless about everything they have to endure as I did back then.
94787375: What's that? You want to learn some Sumeru Akademiya magic? I'm afraid it might be a bit too much for you to handle right now... Hmm, though I suppose it can't hurt to teach you some of the basics. Here, start by reading the beginner's guide, it's only 800 pages or so.
94987487:
#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>There always seems to be people throwing Mora into the fountain on Erinnyes.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Yeah. Supposedly, the fountain fairies listen to people's wishes. That's probably how the custom began.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Huh? So even fountain fairies need Mora?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Whoa, they must be living the dream! All they need to do is find a fountain to live in, and they're all set! No need to work, just sit back and wait for people to literally throw Mora to you.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>I don't think that's quite how it works... You have to grant wishes, remember?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Oh, okay, well... "Oh young traveler, your wishes have been heard. Which lost sword is it that you seek? The Dull Blade, or the Silver Sword?"
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>They both look like trash, to be honest.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Just choose one.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>"Oh fair maiden of the fountain, neither of these swords is mine, and neither do I desire, for what I seek is my lost travel companion."
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Huh? You... You are a sneaky one, young traveler... Okay then, the fountain fairy shall grant your wish and become your best travel companion ever!
96171879: The world remains constant over the centuries. But human life is like the dew at dawn or a bubble rising through water. Transitory.
96722343: At first, our only enemies were roaming bandits, pirates, and monsters. But then, everything changed when the Raiden Shogun enacted the Vision Hunt Decree. The Shogun's Army marched up expecting to put us in our place, but we were ready for them, and we hit them hard. Hehe, I bet they never expected to meet such fierce resistance.
98514495: The moon shines bright over the depths of the seas as the tides come and go. It seems that as I go from strength to strength, so does my state of mind flow.
99385519: She defeated my friend in a duel before the throne, which I accept as proof of her great strength. But she uses that strength to serve as an oppressor's lackey, leading the Kujou Clan's troops to relentlessly seek out and confiscate Visions. This... I cannot forgive.
99546471: Genius? ...A number of people call me that. But I don't think I'm any "genius."
99567023: Y'know, the Millelith used to get in my way all the time. Can't set up a stage here, can't perform there. Real bother, it was... Ahem. But after I wrote to the Ministry of Civil Affairs, I heard that the Tianquan amended one of Liyue's... Uh, some rule or something. She designated some spots for performances to take place, so long as you apply. *sigh* It's still a load of trouble if you ask me, but it's better than being harangued by those Millelith every time, so...
100398167: Noon is upon us, we should eat. Hm? I... I will have a salad, for simplicity is the way of the astrologer.
100820079: In adventuring, as in business, you always have to seize the opportunity while it's there.
103618391: No need to wait up for me. Please, get some sleep. Something bothering you? Oh, don't worry about me — I'm right at the end of my experiment. I promise I won't stay up late again...
105755487: My companions keep getting injured, but I'm unable to share the burden of their pain. The only thing I can do is my absolute very best to heal their wounds! I'll make sure that everyone is healthy.
106452615: Isn't it obvious? There's more than meets the eye to that rich tycoon. He's confident, yet discreet... and even a little bit dangerous.
108842655: Nigredo is the first step in alchemy, drawing from primordial forms. As beings who live in this world, we must find our own meaning.
111120743: <color=#37FFFF>Oz:</color> Good morning. Mein Fräulein heard you'd be dropping by, so she's preparing breakfast.\n<color=#37FFFF>Fischl:</color> Oz! ...Ahem. To what do I owe the pleasure?
112729103: ...Hold! I need to service my musket before the mechanism freezes.
116112079: If you hadn't put yourself out there during the Vision Hunt Ceremony and taken on the Raiden Shogun all by yourself, I would've lost my Vision, and with it all my aspirations. I've been thinking about this a lot, and it seems like there's only one way I could ever properly repay you... \nI, Thoma, give to you my weapon and my loyalty, and I promise to fight for you, no matter what.
117812447: Tell me, how has Mr. Zhongli been lately? Not bad, you say? Seems he's had no problem acclimating to "mortal" life. Hmph, he sure had me fooled. Such a fiasco mustn't be so easily forgiven! The only way to reconciliation is fierce combat! What do you mean I'm no match for him? Hahaha...
117937399: Oh, good morning! ...I prepared the breakfast we usually eat in the expeditionary force. If you don't mind, maybe you could tell me our plan of action for today while you eat.
118904711: The sheer vastness of the desert is perfect for keeping certain things buried and out of sight.
120079719: She's a very strong person. Strong people will always manage to keep themselves together no matter what happens, acting like everything is fine. 120140071:

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Mondstadt has so many windmills, doesn't it?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> Well, the city is built above water, so it probably relies on the windmills to draw the water upwards.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> That's correct! The winds blow through Mondstadt all year, so this supply of water is very stable.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Also, the windmills are what they call "visible winds" — and wind chimes are called the "audible winds."
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Paimon guesses they can be thought of as mascots and prayers to the Anemo Archon for protection.

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Khedive and Anisa kept talking about "Purbiruni" this and "Pursina" that...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Why do all these words have "pur" at the front?

I don't hate the guy, I mean, he's still my dad and everything, it's just... every time he opens his mouth, it's a verbal assault, and I'd rather stay out of his line of fire!

<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>You know, when you're playing a card game, the fancier your hairstyle, the more distracting it is for your opponent.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>"What's going on with this guy? How did he manage to shape his hair like that?"
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>When your opponent's mind is consumed with thoughts like this, you'll quickly gain the upper hand.

<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>"What's up with her? And what's that pesky flying companion of hers up to?"

<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>I, on the other hand, would be completely unfazed by his hairstyle. So I'd be able to focus, and victory would be mine.

378563543: I'm a little low on energy.

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>In Inazuma, it's customary for parents to choose a lucky name for their child.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Those names symbolize everyone's expectations and wishes for the child, like prosperity, wealth, good health, and safety.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Because of these expectations, parents often pick extra long names, and cram all sorts of blessings into them.

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Do you think Yoimiya's dad's poor hearing is related to fireworks?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>He's been making and testing fireworks for many years now, and being exposed to the sound of gunpowder explosions on a daily basis... Paimon can see how that might've worn down his ears...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Yikes! Since Yoimiya is inheriting her family business, does that mean she'll have trouble hearing other people in the future, just like her dad?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Paimon won't let that happen! Let's think of some way to help her!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Do you have any suggestions, Paimon?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Uh... Um...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Paimon could follow Yoimiya around and cover her ears whenever needed...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Then you'd need to leave me.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>...Without Paimon, you'd lose your guide. Paimon wouldn't leave you like that!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>But... What should we do for Yoimiya...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Actually, she can simply wear earplugs while working with fireworks.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Oh yeah! Paimon didn't think of that solution! You're so smart!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Heh... That was the first thing that came to my mind, but I wanted to give you an opportunity for a mental workout.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Eh? So you knew this whole time, but didn't tell Paimon?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>How could you! You bully!
419217935: The Historia Naturalis Liyue has an entry about a waterborne plant called the Horsetail. It claims that "The Horsetail is a medicinal herb that stands alone on the banks of Dihua Marsh. Its color is that of the clouds at sunset." Apparently, if you grind it into a powder and mix it into your ink, it makes your writing water-resistant. But it's a shame, I've been to Dihua Marsh at least a hundred times, and each time I end up with baskets and baskets of the common purple variety, but not a single one of the kind that the book describes.

For example, there's "The Observer" for celebrity gossip, "Leisure Weekly," which focuses on competitive sport and other entertainment news, "Top Chef" for those who like to read... all the food critiques in one place, and "Bedazzled!" which is just sort of a glorified rumor and speculation mill. #<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>People in the city keep telling us how Palais Mermonia is a suuuper stressful place to work.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>But when we went to see it for ourselves, it seemed like hardly anyone works there, and the few people who do work there were hardly working.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>In fact, they looked like they didn't have a care in the world... What part of working there is supposed to be so stressful, exactly?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Maybe the work they carry out is essential, but insignificant.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>How can something be both of those things at the same time?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Well... Okay, so imagine that one day, you suddenly forgot how to fly and fell to the ground...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>That'll never happen. Flying's a piece of cake for Paimon.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Probably not — but just in case, we should make sure that there's a cart loaded with cushions ready to catch you at all times.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>The cart would have to be designed to withstand any environment and weather conditions, and the cushions would need to be soft enough to break your fall gently...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>It would need to be built from the sturdiest timber and strongest rope, and packed with plenty of medical supplies and snacks...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>And all because keeping Paimon safe and sound is absolutely essential.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>You really mean that? Aw, thanks, hehe... But there's really no need to go to all that trouble.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Paimon's been flying for a really long time. There's no way Paimon's gonna suddenly drop out of the air. So you don't need to worry about it.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>See? That's why it's insignificant.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>If it ever did happen, the consequences would be disastrous — hence why it's essential to be prepared.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>But practically speaking, the chances of it happening are next to nothing. So it's insignificant at the same time.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>If someone in the Palais Mermonia was assigned a task like that, it'd be up to them to decide how busy they wanna get. Chances are, they'd probably just sit back and do nothing.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>But... What if Paimon really does forget how to fly one day? What's gonna happen when Paimon falls to the ground?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>I'll be here to catch you, no matter what. Because you're not "essential but insignificant" — you're the best travel companion ever!
521792239: My legs are so sore... *sigh* Guess I must have been sleepwalking last night... again.

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>People in the city keep telling us how Palais Mermonia is a suuuper stressful place to work.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>But when we went to see it for ourselves, it seemed like hardly anyone works there, and the few people who do work there were hardly working.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>In fact, they looked like they didn't have a care in the world... What part of working there is supposed to be so stressful, exactly?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Maybe the work they carry out is essential, but insignificant.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>How can something be both of those things at the same time?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Well... Okay, so imagine that one day, you suddenly forgot how to fly and fell to the ground...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>That'll never happen. Flying's a piece of cake for Paimon.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Probably not — but just in case, we should make sure that there's a cart loaded with cushions ready to catch you at all times.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>The cart would have to be designed to withstand any environment and weather conditions, and the cushions would need to be soft enough to break your fall gently...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>It would need to be built from the sturdiest timber and strongest rope, and packed with plenty of medical supplies and snacks...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>And all because keeping Paimon safe and sound is absolutely essential.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>You really mean that? Aw, thanks, hehe... But there's really no need to go to all that trouble.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Paimon's been flying for a really long time. There's no way Paimon's gonna suddenly drop out of the air. So you don't need to worry about it.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>See? That's why it's insignificant.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>If it ever did happen, the consequences would be disastrous — hence why it's essential to be prepared.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>But practically speaking, the chances of it happening are next to nothing. So it's insignificant at the same time.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>If someone in the Palais Mermonia was assigned a task like that, it'd be up to them to decide how busy they wanna get. Chances are, they'd probably just sit back and do nothing.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>But... What if Paimon really does forget how to fly one day? What's gonna happen when Paimon falls to the ground?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>I'll be here to catch you, no matter what. Because you're not "essential but insignificant" — you're the best travel companion ever!

696520783: I once spent six months working undercover for an exposé piece about a merchant who was selling shoddy food products. I disguised myself as a vagrant, infiltrated the back kitchen, took a job as a kitchen hand, and stuck around until I'd gathered enough solid evidence about their misdeeds. Then, I put it all in an article and had it published in the paper. The backlash was intense. They were punished for their crimes, sure, but that didn't stop them from launching a vicious campaign of vengeance against me almost immediately. I was coming home to threat letters sitting on my bedside table on a daily basis, and we'd also find mud slung on the front door to our office... The Steambird quickly filed a report to the Gardes, and I was sent to Mondstadt to report on Genius Invokation TCG. It took a while before I could safely return to Fontaine. These kind of things happen all the time. I honestly don't know Euphrasie deals with it...

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Fontaine's aquabuses are pretty cool. But imagine if they could run without tracks. Then you could go anywhere you want pretty much without having to move a muscle! Traveling would be way less tiring.

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Fontaine's aquabuses are pretty cool. But imagine if they could run without tracks. Then you could go anywhere you want pretty much without having to move a muscle! Traveling would be way less tiring.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>But you already fly everywhere. Does that even get tiring?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Fly... Fly? Wait, that's it! If we could find a way to make the boats float in the air, then they wouldn't need rails anymore. Hehe, and we could call them "airboats"!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>C'mon, let's go apply for one of those, uh... oh yeah — "patents"! We can't let Paimon's genius go to waste. Quick, before someone else beats us to it!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Patents don't work like that... You can't just have a name for your invention. You also need to provide details of the original technical solution that makes your airboats float.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Technical, huh? Hmm... Okay, got it! We just need to attach a giant propeller on top of the boats!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Okay... But how would you prevent the boat from spinning along with the propeller? And how would you control the direction of movement?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Um... Uh... Ugh. Paimon never realized flying was so complicated! It's always been second nature to Paimon...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Hmm... Well, there might be an easier solution if we ditch the direction and speed control requirements?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Huh? Really!?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Yeah. It involves starting at a high altitude and flying downwards at a rapidly-increasing velocity.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Hey! That isn't flying, that's free-falling!

<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Over the years, many heroes and swordsmen have also chosen Dihua Marsh as the location of their duels.

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>At the Fontaine Research Institute, they research clockwork and different energy sources, right? So how come there are rumors about a mystery treasure?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>It'd make more sense if the treasure was owned by a bandit or a pirate.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>But Paimon's not sure that the researchers' and technicians' definition of "treasure" is really mysterious enough to get excited about...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Hmm... What about "researcher by day, bandit by night"? Does that sound mysterious enough?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Umm... Well for starters, it sounds exhausting. Imagine finishing your day job, then working a whole other job all night... When would they get time to rest?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Maybe they wouldn't need to rest... If they were actually a clockwork meka in disguise!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Ooh! A mystery treasure left by a clockwork meka who's a researcher by day and a bandit by night... Now that sounds more like it!
953269927: The final stage of my journey, or Kaiden, is the study of the most profound techniques. Unavoidably, these draw heavily on elemental power, rendering them beyond the capabilities of most mortals. Most practitioners of other traditions are unable to ever reach this level.
953384999: Hey, thanks for going and gathering all those materials for me. I would've gone myself, but... I probably would've got about halfway before falling asleep.
953805983: No one's joined me on an adventure in ages. C'mon, let's go!
954134807: It's said that there are a wide variety of mushroom species native to Sumeru's rainforests, and that some species can even cause hallucinatory effects, which may have medicinal value. However, I've never had the opportunity to study these mushrooms in detail. I'm thinking to go and have a look for myself the next time I'm on vacation.
954296823: As long as she is not setting off fireworks in my camp, I will cause her no trouble. Heh, yes, I know — all else aside, her fireworks are spectacular and brilliant, and she deserves all the praise she gets. The issue for me is that fireworks are fleeting in nature. After one brief moment of dazzling light, all that remains is the pitch-black night sky, the same as before. So I often have to caution myself not to become too captivated by this illusory spectacle. It is transient, but Inazuma is eternal, and my mission is to protect Inazuma.
954345511: I've already tried to persuade you every way possible... *sigh* Have it your way, cutie. I can no longer go on pretending at this point — even a Hilichurl would see through the act. So be it, let me introduce you to the true Witch of Purple Rose.
954625927: I like Lupical. I like the woods. I like my friend. I like to run!
955531719: I am Keqing, Yuheng of the Liyue Qixing. We live in an era of change, as the old order that has existed for a thousand years is about to be rewritten. Join me. Let us bear witness to this historical moment together.

957004511:
#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Pretty crazy how things that happened only yesterday show up in today's issue of The Steambird...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Even stuff that happened late at night way outside the city makes it in. How do they manage to get these articles written up so quickly?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Yeah, not to mention printed first thing in the morning.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Hehe, Paimon gets it! There must be a magic printer at The Steambird's office. As soon as the reporters bring in the latest news, they feed it to the printer, and it goes om-nom-nom-nom-nom, gobbling all the writing up ready to spit it back out when it's printing time!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>They probably have some reporters bursting in through the doors at the last minute, yelling "WAIT! There's one last article to feed to the printer!"
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>That's definitely a very compelling image. But as far as I know, magic printers like that don't exist — it's all thanks to the tireless work of the editing team that The Steambird gets printed on time every day. They sit there going "Huh? Hmph! Uhh... Oh no!" as they race through correcting spelling errors, then they squeeeeeeeze it all into neat vertical columns of text, and run to their colleagues shouting "Just give me five more minutes, please!" That's the real magic behind meeting publishing deadlines.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Whoa... It's pretty amazing that they're able to make a whole newspaper in just one day. Do they ever get time to sleep?
957691327: Have you tried one of Diona's drinks? Oh right, you're still underage. Haha, such a shame, it truly is — to not be able to revel with you in such bliss. Hehe, I guess all we can do is wait for you to be old enough.

959378543: My contraptions are calibrated. We may now depart.

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Paimon wonders what the previous Shogun was like.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> It appears that she was a person who understood the fleeting nature of things, and accepted the inevitable fate of departing this world one day.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> After all, realizing the fragility of things in front of you makes you treasure them even more.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> This way of thinking must've influenced Inazuma's aesthetics. This world is transient, people come and go. The fun times we shared, our companionship, and the delicious foods we got to savor — those emotions and experiences are real things that existed at some point in time, not just empty concepts.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Even though... Even though every banquet must eventually come to an end, it'd be nice to enjoy those happy moments for a little longer.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> "Shifting seasons and elusive dreams, the ephemeral and fleeting, with thine companionship, all are eternal."
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Paimon doesn't get it!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> I'm saying that I'm having a lot of fun traveling with you, Paimon. It'd be nice if we could just go on like this forever.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Paimon'll take your word for it then.

<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Oh... yeah...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>In any case, surely the evidence isn't just dropping itself off at the detective's doorstep.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>You mean... Oh, the detective must have people collecting information for them...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Perhaps, or... Maybe they post commissions at the Adventurers' Guild?

Seeing everyone cooped up in their abodes with nothing to do, one created a Snowdrift Mechanism for skiing on the mountains. One was having a tremendous time of it along with Guizhong and Streetward Rambler... until, of course, Moon Carver noticed as much and decided to join in. Moments later, he had managed to send the mechanism flying off the rails and plummeted deep into a snow bank. It took us hours to dig him out... Later, one introduced a great many safety features to the mechanism, to the point where it could be safely piloted by even a three-year-old child. Although this did entail a compromise on the top speed of the vehicle.

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Port Ormos is built on the ruins of the fortress of The Alliance of the... the... the alliance of something, anyway.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Ugh, the name's too long, Paimon can't remember it! Anyway, that's what all the bookish people in Sumeru say.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Oh, you mean "The Alliance of the Twenty-Nine Ocean Deys"?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Apparently, the alliance was formed by a bunch of arrogant pirate leaders, none of whom wanted to work for any of the others. They fought and looted each other constantly, causing endless chaos in coastal Sumeru...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Finally, one day, they decided to enter into an alliance with one another and divide power equally between themselves. The members of the alliance were called "Deys"...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Oh... And so after that... there was no more fighting and no more stealing, so everyone could get along happily and make a boatload of Mora together! Right?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Right...?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Well... presumably that's what they were hoping...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Huh...?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Before long, they were forming factions again, and the infighting between them escalated into the biggest internal battle they'd seen yet. Their fortress at Port Ormos was completely destroyed, and all the Deys were done for!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Whaaat?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Following that, an unprecedented period of peace finally came to Port Ormos, and the area began to develop into what we see today...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Huh... So the Alliance was just a bunch of dumb bad guys...

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Paimon's heard that the earliest clockwork components ever invented actually work on a very simple principle!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>You take a long object made from a durable material, bend it, and wait for it to return to its original shape. As it rebounds, you can use the energy it gives off to power gears and stuff, and then you basically have an engine!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Hmm... A long object made from a durable material... *gasp* You know what that reminds me of?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Cryo and Pyro Regisvines! Don't you think?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Eek! Of all the things you could've thought of, why those two?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Huh, but come to think of it, the regisvines are pretty good at whipping their stalks around...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>And they're really strong too. If you let them charge up their energy and swing at you...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>They'll knock down anyone in their path. Even me — and we both know how strong I am!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>So are you saying that... you could turn the Regisvines into a clockwork mechanism?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Well, think about it. Since Cryo and Pyro lifeforms are highly incompatible, if we put them both next to each other at a slight incline, so their necks are tilted towards one another...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>They'd spin non-stop to avoid touching each other!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>It would be the world's most powerful clockwork mechanism! Once we found a way to harness it, it would generate enough energy to power most of the machines in Fontaine!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Ohhh! Yeah, you're right!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>This is a genius idea! Eat your heart out, Fontaine Research Institute!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>All we need to do now is find a way to bring the Regisvines to Fontaine, put them in position, and...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Wait a sec... How the heck are we gonna get those overgrown ferns to Fontaine?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>As soon as we've tackled the minor issues of practicality and cost-effectiveness...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>...How about we explore the details ahead of us later?

Her successor chose instead to seek equality by means of the law. Ultimately, due to various external factors, this unfortunately manifested itself in the distorted form of trials for the sake of trials. Nevertheless, there are reasons for everything. I suppose I should refrain from criticizing her.

1501769239:
#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>The Steambird's head office is in Fontaine, right? Paimon wonders what stories make it into their newspapers.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Do you think they reported on our adventures with Dvalin? Or our duel with the Raiden Shogun? Oh, and everything that happened at the Akademiya!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>I'm sure they cover just about everything that goes on. It's more a question of where it would appear — they probably have different sections reserved for different topics.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Ooh, well in that case, we must make it onto the front page all the time! Surely that's where all the most exciting stories go.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Hmm... I'm not so sure. We might've made front-page news once or twice, I guess. But I wouldn't be surprised if the headlines mostly focus on hit new operas or well-known actors.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>You know, stuff like, "Actor X Spotted Drinking Coffee on Street," "Actor Y Goes Public About New Relationship," or "Actor Z to Retire From Performing."
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Why would they fill the best page with stuff like that? It's completely pointless.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Well... trivial, maybe, but not pointless. Those are the stories that grab people's attention and convince them to buy the paper to get all the details.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>*sigh* ...Fine. Well... Maybe we'll be on the first few pages then? Surely, they've gotta put some real news in there. And it's gotta be interesting enough to keep people reading after they've gotten their dose of celebrity gossip. Right?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>The first few pages cover positive local news stories in the Court of Fontaine. Things like food and commodity prices going down, or progress updates on the aquabus expansions.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>They put these reports at the most prominent locations inside the newspaper. The point of them is mostly just to kill time.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>What goes on at the Akademiya might be important, but it doesn't directly impact the lives of people in Fontaine.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Huh... So, where would they put our stories then?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>I'd guess on the very back page, after everything else.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Aww... Why so far back!?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>I think they call it... "saving the best till last."
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>The editors probably embellish things a lot to flesh the story out, then break it into several chunks to make it into a series that runs over several days.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Alright, so... what's the "point" of the final page, then?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>It gives the newspaper its "raison d'etre."
1502721175: I'm sorry, I can't really think of any good stories to share... the ones I do know will just bring down your mood.
1503365167: Mmm, yummy! What do you say we partner up, hmm? You could also be my personal chef!

<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Not only does the rhythm need to match, but the meaning has to as well.

<color=#37FFFF>Paimon:</color> Uh... "Windrise's winds never churn."
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}:</color> ...Um, "But the Sea of Clouds' clouds always return."

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Cyno's super into that card game "Genius Invokation TCG," isn't he?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Doesn't it seem kinda weird for the General Mahamatra to be into playing cards...?

<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>When you're playing a card game, the fancier your hairstyle, the more distracting it is for your opponent.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>"What's going on with this guy? How did he manage to shape his hair like that?"
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>When your opponent's mind is consumed with thoughts like this, you'll quickly gain the upper hand.

<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>I don't know... I think I might just have an advantage over him.

<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>I, on the other hand, would be completely unfazed by his hairstyle. So I'd be able to focus, and victory would be mine.

<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Of course... Ah! ...No, no! Paimon's only concerned about your safety, {NICKNAME}!

#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Those Onikabuto bugs look so scary! The patterns on their backs are terrifying!

<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Ugh! Paimon's head is going to explode. Let's stick to festival masks for now.

1624301679:
#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>In Inazuma, it's customary for parents to choose a lucky name for their child.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Those names symbolize everyone's expectations and wishes for the child, like prosperity, wealth, good health, and safety.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Because of these expectations, parents often pick extra long names, and cram all sorts of blessings into them.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>So hypothetically, if one day a little girl fell into a lake on her way back home, then her friends might rush to her house to tell everyone, "Something bad happened!"
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>"Oh, what happened?"
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Ozvaldo Hrafnavins, Prinzessin der Verurteilung Fischl von Luftschloss Narfidort, come quick! Centennial Genius Astrologist Mona Megistus has fallen into the water!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>...Mona falling into the water doesn't sound like an emergency situation though.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Precisely. The fast-swimming Mona would come back home around the same time her friends are done saying her name, haha.
1625909679: It's time for the curtain... to fall...
1626680463: If you're looking for some kind of thrilling story, I'm afraid I don't have one. Even when I was studying medicine under my late Master, I didn't experience any particularly dire situations. My master saw that I had a good head on my shoulders, had me swear a simple oath, and took me in... That's all there was to it.
1628139327: Humans are just fascinating creatures, that's why I'm so fond of them. They live such short lives, but for the time they're around, they shine as bright as the midday sun. There are some whose light never grows dim, even over great stretches of time... These are the lives that make for real page-turners.
1628279967: Her Excellency once warned me of my fatal flaw... I tend to get too engrossed in battle, fighting deep into enemy lines and forgetting about everything else. She told me that my bravery is commendable, but as a ranking officer, it's not my place to do this. I'm doing my best to improve, but... Would you also be able to keep an eye on me?
1629180087: My family makes a living by growing precious medicinal herbs. My parents often get so busy that they forget about the housework, and sometimes they even forget to eat! Tsk, isn't that awful? Good thing they've got me to look after them.
1629186359: Hello, my name's Freminet, I'm a diver... Oh, no need to shake hands. I mean, no need to be so formal. Ahem, if you need help surveying underwater ruins or salvaging materials, I can be of some use to you. But for anything else... You might find me a disappointment.
1629587223: You want to learn some Favonius Bladework? Heh, alright then, I'll teach you... Oh yes, I'll teach you, alright, mark my words...
1629835655: "May the gentle breeze softly send thee into a sweet sleep." ...One of a select few aristocratic pleasantries that's actually quite lovely.
1629880455: The assumption that every person has somewhere to call home is naive. I got used to living in the mountains alongside the birds and beasts a long time ago.
1630648367: The weather and our moods are the same — they can both get gloomy. It's all right, though, because the sky will become even brighter after the rain.
1630697127: Hmm, which opera shall we perform today?
1631937703: The Fortress of Meropide doesn't need her services. Yet some things are best preserved the way they are, warts and all, so people don't make the same mistakes twice... I say warts, but yeah. I mean the smell.
1632335231:
#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Huh, novels in Fontaine have weirdly long names. This one's called "Do Clockwork Meka Dream of Cogwheel Chiropractors?"
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>But the writing style and themes are pretty different from Inazuma's light novels.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>According to the synopsis, this novel is about a clockwork meka experiencing back pain due to bending over for extended periods. It finally gives in, quits its job as an illustrator, then goes on a long journey looking for a chiropractor to cure its mechanical spine...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>That actually sounds pretty interesting.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>But why a chiropractor, though? Wouldn't an engineer do the job better? They could just go to the Fontaine Research Institute, and save themselves the long journey.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Well yeah, but... Having met some of the engineers from the institute, Paimon can see why they wouldn't want to...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Oh yeah, that's true. But anyway, even though the protagonist of the story is a clockwork meka, you can still tell that it was written by a human. Imagine if they got a real clockwork meka to write a novel... I wonder what they'd write about?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Hmm... How about this: "I Awoke One Morning and Found Myself Human!"
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Hey, that's a good one, Paimon.

1635407399: I always get so gloomy when it rains...

1656095815: People love talking about the past and often regret the beautiful things that have now faded into history. They also love to talk about the future, as if they're willing to sacrifice everything for an uncertain tomorrow. I don't agree with their way of thinking, yet I also feel very envious... I once lived in a world without a past or a future. To cope with that anxiety, I tried to create and act out a stronger, more god-like version of myself. Over the centuries, the stronger role I tried to play gradually merged with my real self. Even I can't separate the two now... but perhaps there's no need to distinguish them. Experiences of the past have formed who I am now, and that flawed performance has also become the most important part of me.

<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>How is anyone supposed to understand that!

<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>"Vociferous Pestiferous Melliculus Niveous Micro-Bipedal."
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>That's the scientific name, of course.

<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>"Noisy Two-Legged Critter"

Most people don't agree — sakura trees that will never bloom again are removed. But when I look at a tree, all I want is to see it blossom again... just one more time...

Whenever we are together, it is vital that we always shine a light for each other, okay? It's rather difficult to remain enlightened in the dark.
1691559775: I'm about to pass out over here.

The two of us meeting each other is really the culmination of every choice and move we've made up to this point. So what I'm saying is... our destiny is something we choose.

1692903247: Trifling matters can become Jean's greatest enemy.
1694056367:
#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>So many people in Sumeru want to become scholars.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Motivated by this ambition, they all study really hard to try and achieve it...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>But Paimon bets that the first ever scholar didn't set out to become a scholar...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Hmm... so what do you think the first ever scholar's ambition was?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Probably... to get their research paper written as quickly as possible.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Huh? But isn't a scholar's ultimate goal supposed to be "pursuing the highest and greatest knowledge" or something?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Paimon's sure that it must have been because of a fervent desire for knowledge that they became Sumeru's first true scholar.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Writing papers is how you pursue knowledge.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>But what about when it's the highest and greatest knowledge of all...
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Even then, if you wanted to prove it, you'd need a research paper.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>And after that, you'd need to start working on another paper to validate your original thesis...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>O—Okay, Paimon's got it! Come on, don't look so sad! It's not like you have to worry about writing papers yourself!
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>...Y—You've never had to write a paper before, right...?
1696107055: Well you know, many of Liyue's legends are centered around stories of gods and the adepti, so most operas focus on the supernatural, too. A prime example would be "The Divine Damsel of Devastation," which we have been performing recently. Long-time opera fans adore this sort of material, but in this age of humanity, I would rather like to tell stories about ordinary people. Yes, how grand it would be to sing about the hopes and dreams of ordinary people for all to hear. I've never shared these thoughts with anyone before... Thank you for listening so patiently. I'm fortunate to have a close friend like you.
1696715839: Germinating seeds break through the soil and take root.
1696899735: The Vishaps' ancestry can be traced directly back to the Fontemer, which is why they are so adept at evolution. I am reminded of an old custom that the dragons once observed: We would take a sip of our perished young brethren's blood. Whenever the tides are disrupted by the motion of the moon and stars, the water within the bodies of us Hydro organisms surges up towards our heads, reminding us that our deceased kin will soon be revived.
1697000295: Fontaine does have some rather intriguing laws on its books. For instance, "it is forbidden to release any flying objects during the first three days of each month," "during the dry season, all bivalves that wash ashore belong to the Hydro Archon, while other mollusks belong to the people," "no domestic pets shall be named after Furina," "tomato ketchup is to be consumed in restaurants only as a condiment, never on its own," and, finally, "Melusines are to be addressed using she/her pronouns, never the impersonal it/its"... That last one was my personal contribution.
1698329119: May my final stand be a monument to chivalry.
1698504903: Though it may be said that it is in a child's nature to play, the things Klee plays with are far from toys. I can never take my eye off her.
1698712239: Mm... Not bad... Why are you staring at me?
1699011119: Lesser Lord Kusanali is a wise and capable god. Not only is she extremely knowledgeable, she also possesses virtue far beyond mortal comprehension. I have only the utmost respect for her tolerance of others — especially in a nation of learning like Sumeru, that takes great equanimity.\nSometimes, though, I do stop to wonder... Surely even the gods must have their struggles, too? Oftentimes, confusion is the beginning of wisdom... In which case, how can we ever achieve true happiness?
1699261023: In the past, I would let the doves I raised fly freely, and they would always return to me. But there was once when a few didn't return, and by the time we tracked them down, they'd been turned into dove pie. Even now I still don't know how to give them both freedom and safety.
1700431583: Father? I'm not familiar with the word. You could say that I don't have one — could also say I have many, too. What's it to you?
1702657791: As the eldest daughter of the Kamisato Clan, she always looks very graceful and elegant. But she got one of the shrine maidens to keep tabs on me and make sure I don't slack off... Why would she do that?
1702810495:
#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Inazuma's scenery is quite different than what we've seen so far.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Yeah, Inazuma's an island nation.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Before the invention of boats, how did the people living on different islands communicate with one another?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>According to Yoimiya's dad, they probably used smoke signals to transmit information.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Or, they would...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Yeah...?
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>They would commission people who could freeze the water surface to travel between the islands and deliver messages.
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Whoa! If Kaeya had lived in Inazuma back then, he would've been even busier than Master Jean now!
1705376623: The world always seems quieter when it snows.
1706069327: Am I ready to depart? Let me put it to you like this. If you were to make a habit of asking me this question every time before you move out, you would find that you only receive an answer from me one time out of 10. The other nine times, I would already be fighting fiercely on the front line. Not because I am foolhardy, nor because I lack courtesy, but because the battle never waits till you are ready.
1706185551: Hmm... Well, if you really wanna know... When I have a bad day, I feel a bit glum. Like, it sucks when I come back empty-handed from an adventure, or when one of my dads' old injuries starts acting up. But... they're just small things, really. After a good night's sleep, I forget all about them. New day, new start! Haha!
1706949359: You want to know about Diluc? Haha, in that case, I know someone else you should talk to.
1708356247: Oh, I know who you're talking about. Lisa Minci — the legendary Spantamad prodigy who graduated in just two years. If only I had her brains... Huh? You met her in person when you were in Mondstadt? R—Really? So... what's her studying process like? What books does she read, and what kind of work does she do? Where... Where should I start if I want to learn from her?
1709568879:
#<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Gardemeks carry out whatever task they're programmed to do. So basically, they can do whatever you tell them to!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Got another bright idea, Paimon?
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Yep! Paimon needs a commission-handling Gardemek, a material-harvesting Gardemek, and a domain-exploring Gardemek...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Ooh, and a gourmet-chef Gardemek, too! Then we can sit back and enjoy our new, fully automated lifestyle!
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>They're extremely expensive to own and operate, though. And don't forget there's maintenance and repair costs as well.
<color=#37FFFF>{NICKNAME}: </color>Okay, lemme do some quick napkin-math here... Using a Gardemek, the average cost to harvest a single Mint would come to around 6,300 Mora...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>What!? That's eye wateringly expensive...
<color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>...Suddenly, Paimon feels like we adventurers don't get paid enough for the high-value work we do!
1714314759: We are not fighting against any particular group or faction. No, we fight against a destructive malice — a malice that has trampled the aspirations of the people and destroyed the peaceful lives they once knew. After I rid the land of such evil I will be able to peacefully lay down my weapon. Only then will I trade my uniform for civilian attire... and finally stroll the beautiful landscape of Watatsumi Island together with you.
1719246111: I'm very grateful to Neuvillette for all the hard work he's done for Fontaine in the past few centuries. It seems he doesn't intend to investigate my crimes of deceiving the people. Anyway, we're no longer working in tandem, and it's been a long time since I've been to the Palais Mermonia. I imagine that this is good for both of us, right?
1719272783: After I got my Vision, I didn't need my helmet to go diving anymore. But... I can't bear to be without it. It cuts me off from the noise of the outside world, and makes me feel safe. My Vision, Pers, and my helmet... I draw my strength from them every time I take a breath.
1719555327: Hmm, according to our intel, she is a ninja proficient in the art of infiltration — a skill set which could prove very useful in some of Her Excellency's special operations... Oh, well forget it then.
1720032783: Sorry... For a moment there I had the urge to run for my life. But that wouldn't be fair to you.
1721042471: One time, Shenhe ate too many Qingxin in one go and she was sick for days! And that's why I've got to take care of myself and not eat raw Qingxin. Hmm? How did I know about that? Aunty Cloud Retainer told me!
1721630423: Everything has a certain way it should taste. I won't touch anything that tries to break the mold, so no salted Almond Tofu for me, and no sweetened Lotus Seed and Bird Egg Soup either. It's just a total waste of perfectly good ingredients.
1723264559: The food you cook is indisputably delicious. I can't refuse it.
1724157487: The customs of the opera are very particular, and are passed down from generation to generation. Sometimes I find that I only know the hows but not the whys behind what we do. 1724179231: I feel like I'm lying down on the back of a massive Anemo Slime. Ahh, it's so light and comfy~
1725181175: Even after eating something really filling like ramen or gyoza, I still always want to finish my meal with a small bowl of rice. Rice is just delicious, that's all. Is there a problem with that?
1725471935: Been a while since I've limbered up.
1725656447: Bennett... Much talking. Eat with him, never full.
1726124047: You didn't have to do this for me, you know. I'd obey you regardless.
1726195271: Such a calming breeze... Perfect for taking a nap, don't you think?
1727207167: Ack! Gotta find some cover, quick, or my hairdo's gonna fall apart!
1729236855: Mondstadt is a beast of light, both old and young. Old in the sense that it constantly requires someone's protection, yet too young to ever survive on its own. Why do I call it a beast of light? Because people like myself can only be found in the dark...
1730969119: Hehe, I really appreciate this. It tastes lovely.
1731650023: Dori is the owner of the Palace of Alcazarzaray... Excuse me? Mine? No, don't be ridiculous. I know full well that it doesn't belong to me... I know, I know, but... argh, please, let's not go there!\nDori is a shrewd one. She knows how to coerce others into doing things for her. I, uh... For, ahem, various reasons, I now owe her a large sum of money. It all got quite complicated in the end, but... A—Anyway, I wish she'd show me a little mercy, and stop making my life a misery for the sake of Mora. I swear, she doesn't seem like a bad person at heart, so... I just don't understand, how did she turn out like this?
1732371247: Only by adhering to the law can the people solve life's myriad of problems.
1733228911: I'm fond of the shrubs that grow in the desert. The desert is a symbol of repose and solitude, and all civilizations will eventually be buried by a sandstorm. 1752303207: My processing speed... has become even faster.

1754748103: Dr. Baizhu's prescriptions are pretty effective. They're bitter, that's for sure, but they always say that about medicine: "the bitter the better"! So I get it. Huh? Too bitter for you? Oh, that reminds me, I managed to sign up for one of her upcoming meet-and-greets! I've been counting down the days — wish it would go faster...

1763606495: I presume you mean the girl whom Ganyu has taken under her wing. Do not worry, I have no plans to make this matter public. You should try to convince her to include some more fruits and vegetables in her diet.
1764945039: I'm no fan of Dango, or any other sticky sweets that make me feel like my teeth are fusing together. Keep them to yourself.
1765245439: Even when you're too busy to eat three square meals, never eat something if you don't know where it came from, and always maintain a balance between meat and vegetables. 1766385807: State your query. To the point.

1767378679: Here! I call this Fantastic Summer-Serendipity Coral Sparkling Tea, I just made it one day when I was bored... Huh, you say it's popular? People are lining up to buy it? Don't be ridiculous.

I remember seeing her one day on my way back to Yuehai Pavilion, she was having breakfast with a group of people — they were all talking and laughing, eating, drinking tea... I must admit, I found myself feeling a little envious in that moment.
1768109351: Many people dread the sound of thunder... To me, it sounds fondly familiar.
1769368391: Let me weave you a verse.
1770795295: Once, I was catching fish by the ocean when a crab caught me off guard and pinched my tails from behind. It hurt so bad, I thought they were gonna get snipped off! I could hardly believe it when I learned there's a dish called "Butter Crab." How do humans manage to eat something so hard AND hot?

Ahem, however, I have absolutely no desire to scale the tallest peak in Inazuma...

1777292055: Farewell, dear gulls, please calm your cries. From this day forth, I am a wanderer once more.

1778127735: I know what you're thinking: "I don't see it — how did this guy get to become the boss of the Arataki Gang on the back of beetle fighting and trading card games?" Eating ramen standing upside down, sleeping with my eyes open, playing the harmonica with my nose, and swatting houseflies with my hair. Yeah, I know. Betcha see it now, huh?

As well as being one of the building blocks of human culture and civilization, architecture is also an art form. Art does not exist in a vacuum, so I've always been mindful of the experiential factor for the occupants, and the emotional character conveyed to those looking on from the outside... <color=#37FFFF>Paimon: </color>Just choose one.

With all that in mind, why don't you try to respect the law a bit more around your birthday, so we'll be able to celebrate somewhere nice on the surface?
